These practices include: - Revegetation and Reforestation: Restoring vegetation and forests in mined areas. - Land Reclamation: Rehabilitating land to its natural state. - Water Management: Controlling water pollution and runoff. - Biodiversity Conservation: Protecting local flora and fauna. - Waste Management: Proper disposal and recycling of mining waste. - Dust and Air Pollution Control: Measures to reduce air pollution. - Monitoring and Data Collection: Tracking environmental parameters. - Ecological Impact Assessments: Studying and mitigating environmental impacts. - Community Engagement: Involving and addressing community concerns. - Research and Development: Advancements in clean coal technologies and eco-friendly equipment. These practices aim to minimize the environmental impact of coal mining and promote ecological sustainability.
